intro: Foetidia macrocarpa var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the broad-leafed foetidia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in semi-arid to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter, and its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, and it has adapted to withstand periods of drought. The plant is also noted for its aromatic foliage, which has been used in traditional medicine.
